pre.title: Fund Your Account

post.descTwo: Once claimed, the previous funding address will be made invalid, and your may send and receive funds using your new Account ID:

setupSeedPhrase.pageText: Write down the following words IN ORDER and keep them somewhere safe. You cannot recover your account without them!

hardwareDevices.title: Hardware Devices
hardwareDevices.desc: Improve the security of your account by using a hardware wallet.

ledger.title: Ledger Nano S or X
ledger.disclaimer: In order to disable your ledger device, you must first enable an alternative recovery method.

disable.title: Are you sure you want to disable Ledger?
disable.desc: Make sure you have other recovery methods setup before disabling.

twoFactor.subHeader: Two factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. With 2FA enabled, all transactions must be confirmed using SMS or email.

twoFactor.desc: Protect your account by requiring confirmation via SMS or email when authorizing transactions.
twoFactor.notEnoughBalance: To enable 2FA, your account requires a minimum available balance of
twoFactor.promptDesc: We highly recommend that you set up a two-factor authentication method to increase the security of your account and assests

disable.title: Are you sure you want to disable 2FA?
disable.desc: Keep in mind that transactions won't have to be confirmed with 2FA once it's disabled.

accountId.title: Account ID
accountId.subLabel: Your account ID must include a Top Level Account such as .near or contain exactly 64 characters.

recoverAccount.pageText: If you’ve setup one or more account recovery methods, follow the instructions below to import your account.

email.title: Email
email.desc: Check your email for a message from nearprotocol.com with the subject:
email.subject: "Important: Near Wallet Recovery Email".

phone.title: Phone
phone.desc: Check your phone records for an SMS message from

phrase.title: Seed Phrase
phrase.desc: Make sure you have your 12 word recovery phrase, then click below to begin the recovery process.

ledger.title: Ledger
ledger.desc: Make sure your ledger is connected securely, and that the NEAR app is open on the device.

recoverAccount.actionRequired: This message contains a magic link. Click the link to begin recovery!
recoverAccount.cannotResend: This message was sent when you enabled email/phone recovery. We only send this message once, and cannot resend it.

createAccount.pageText: Just choose an account ID and you’re all set.

note.title: NOTE
note.one: Your account ID can contain any of the following:
note.four: Characters (_-) can be used as separators

invalidLinkDrop.title: Link Invalid
invalidLinkDrop.one: This NEAR Drop has been claimed.
invalidLinkDrop.two: NEAR Drops can only be used to create a single account, after which the link will expire.

topLevelAccounts.body: Account names are similar to domain names. Only the ${suffix} account can create accounts such as yourname.${suffix}, and only yourname.${suffix} can create app.yourname.${suffix}. All accounts created in this wallet use the .${suffix} Top Level Account (TLA). To learn more about account names and creating your own TLA, visit the docs.

recoverSeedPhrase.pageText: Enter the backup seed phrase associated with the account.

setupRecovery.basicSecurityDesc: Enter your email address or phone number and receive a magic link
setupRecovery.phoneDesc: Enter your phone number below and receive a magic recovery link
setupRecovery.advancedSecurityDesc: Write down a 12 word seed (recovery) phrase, or secure your account with your Ledger device.

errors.noWithdraw: Unable to withdraw pending balance from validator

staking.pageText: Setup your Node via CLI, then add it here.

staking.title: Staking
staking.desc: Stake your NEAR tokens with a validator
staking.noValidators: You haven't staked with a validator yet.

staked.title: Total amount staked
staked.info: NEAR tokens currently staked with validators. These tokens are accumulating rewards. To access these tokens, you must first unstake and then withdraw them.

unclaimed.title: Rewards earned
unclaimed.info: Rewards that have been earned, but not withdrawn. Rewards earned are automatically restaked, which means your Total Amount Staked automatically increases over time, and your rewards are compounding.

unavailable.title: Unable to display rewards earned.
unavailable.modalTitle: Unable to display staking rewards earned
unavailable.modalDescOne: We are currently unable to calculate rewards when Two-Factor Authentication is enabled. We hope to enable this functionality in the near future.
unavailable.modalDescTwo: In the meantime, you will be able to see your rewards accumulating under ”Total amount staked”. This balance will grow while your tokens are staked, since your rewards are automatically re-staked with your current validator.

available.title: Available for withdrawal
available.info: These tokens have been unstaked, and are ready to be withdrawn.

pending.title: Pending release
pending.info: These tokens have been unstaked, but are not yet ready to withdraw. Tokens are ready to withdraw 36 to 48 hours after unstaking.

stake.title: Stake Amount
stake.desc: Enter the amount you would like to stake with your chosen validator.
stake.ledgerDisclaimer: Note: If this is your first time staking with this validator, you will need to confirm two transactions
stake.accounts: If you have locked NEAR, you can choose to stake with either your locked NEAR (lockup.near), or your unlocked NEAR (your account name). You will only see the staking positions for the selected account. If you do not have locked NEAR, you can ignore this section

unstake.title: Unstake Tokens
unstake.desc: Enter the number of tokens you would like to unstake from your current validator.
unstake.ledgerDisclaimer: Note: If this is your first time staking with this validator, you will need to confirm two transactions
unstake.beforeUnstakeDisclaimer: Unstaked tokens will be made available pending a release period of ~36-48hrs (3 epochs).

stakeSuccess.title: Success!
stakeSuccess.desc: Your stake has successfully been delegated to your chosen validator:
stakeSuccess.descTwo: You can now view your delegation and staking rewards from your staking dashboard.

unstakeSuccess.title: Success!
unstakeSuccess.desc: ${amount} NEAR has successfully been unstaked from this validator:
unstakeSuccess.descTwo: Your tokens are pending release and will be made available within ~36-48hrs (3 epochs).

validators.title: Select a Validator
validators.desc: Enter a known validator or select a validator from the list to stake your NEAR tokens. You may only stake with a single validator at any given time.

validator.title:
Validator:
@${validator}
validator.desc: This is the fee paid to the validator to stake on your behalf. This fee is only charged on your rewards.
validator.withdrawalDisclaimer: Funds pending release will be made available after ~36-48hrs (3 epochs)

alertBanner.title: You must first unstake and withdraw your tokens from your current validator in order to stake with a new validator.

noValidators.title: You are not currently staking with any validators.

lockPopup.title: Why is this locked?
lockPopup.text: Your account ID is your unique identifier in the system and cannot be changed because data and asset ownership is tied to it. However you are welcome to ${link} with desired name and transfer assets as needed.

details.qrDesc: Use your phone's camera app to send to this address

amountStatusId.howMuch: How much do you want to send?

sendMoney.onceConfirmed: Once confirmed, this cannot be undone.

ActionWarrning.functionCall: No description specified for this function.
ActionWarrning.deployContract: You are about to deploy a contract to your account! This contract can access your NEAR balance, and interact with other contracts on your behalf.
ActionWarrning.stake: You are about to stake NEAR tokens. These tokens will be locked, and are at risk of being lost if your validator becomes unresponsive.
ActionWarrning.deleteAccount: You are about to delete your account! Your NEAR balance will be destroyed, and all of your account data deleted.

sign.hereAreSomeDetails: Here are some details that will help you.

availableBalanceInfo: ”Available Balance” is your spendable NEAR balance. This will be lower than your Total Balance. To view a complete breakdown of your NEAR balance, visit your Profile.
availableBalanceProfile: This is your spendable NEAR balance, and can be used or transferred immediately. This will be lower than your Total Balance.
minimumBalance: This is the minimum NEAR balance your account must maintain to remain active. This balance represents the storage space your account is using on the NEAR blockchain (with a small buffer), and will go up or down as you use more or less space.
totalBalance: Your total balance represents all NEAR tokens under your control. In many cases, you will not have immediate access to this entire balance (e.g. if it is locked, delegated, or staked). Check your Available Balance for the NEAR you can actively use, transfer, delegate, and stake.
stakedBalance: This NEAR is actively being used to back a validator and secure the network. When you decide to unstake this NEAR, it will take some time to be shown in your Available Balance, as NEAR takes 3 epochs (~36 hours) to unstake.
unvestedBalance: Unvested NEAR is earmarked to you, but not yet under your ownership. You can still delegate or stake this NEAR, and the rewards will be entirely yours. As your NEAR is vested, it will appear in either your Locked or Unlocked balance.
lockedBalance: This NEAR is locked in a lockup contract, and cannot be withdrawn. You may still delegate or stake this NEAR. Once the NEAR is unlocked, you can view it in your Unlocked Balance, and chose to withdraw it (moving to your Available Balance).
unlockedBalance: This NEAR is still in a lockup contract, and is ready to be withdrawn. If you choose to withdraw this NEAR, it will appear in your Available Balance.

setupLedger.one:
Connect your Ledger Nano S or X to your computer or mobile device via USB and open the NEAR application.

Then, press both buttons at the 'Pending Ledger Review' screen.
setupLedger.two: If you have not yet installed the NEAR Ledger app, follow

setupLedgerSteps.header: Install NEAR on your Ledger device
setupLedgerSteps.one: Open Ledger Live, install any firmware updates available.
setupLedgerSteps.three: Under Experimental Features, make sure that Developer Mode is switched on.
setupLedgerSteps.four: Return to the Manager tab and search for NEAR.
setupLedgerSteps.five: Follow the instructions to install the NEAR application on your device.

setupLedgerSuccess.one: We recommend that you remove all existing keys (recovery methods and devices).
setupLedgerSuccess.two: Maintaining multiple keys and recovery methods (including seed phrases) increases the vulnerability of your account.
setupLedgerSuccess.primaryCta: Remove Existing Keys and Recovery Methods

one.remove: Before removing your existing keys and recovery methods, make sure that you have recorded and securely stored your Ledger seed phrase.
one.keep: Maintaining multiple recovery methods and devices increases the vulnerability of your account.

two.remove: If you lose access to your seed phrase, NEAR Inc. will be unable to assist you in recovery of your account and its funds.

signInLedger.header: Sign in with your Ledger device
signInLedger.one: Make sure your ledger is connected securely, and that the NEAR app is open on the device.

getLedgerAccountIds.error:
Public key access was rejected. No accounts were recovered.
To continue, you must allow NEAR Wallet to view your public key. Please try again.
getLedgerAccountIds.noAccounts: No accounts are associated with this Ledger device. You must first create an account, then add this Ledger to it to login.
getLedgerAccountIds.U2FNotSupported: U2F browser support is needed for Ledger. Please use Chrome, Opera or Firefox with U2F extension.

addLedgerAccountId.error:
Access to one of the accounts was rejected. No accounts were recovered.
To continue, you must authorize read-only access to each account on your Ledger device. Please try again.
addLedgerAccountId.errorRpc: Error appears while recovering the account.

saveAndSelectLedgerAccounts.success:
You’ve successfully signed in.
${numberOfAccounts} account(s) were recovered. Your most recently created account has been set to active.
saveAndSelectLedgerAccounts.error: Please check that your device is connected and the NEAR app is open.

modal.ledgerMustAdd: Ledger must add an access key for each account protected by your device:

header.confirm: Please confirm the operation on your device...

confirmLedgerModal.one: You will need to confirm your sign-in details on your Ledger.

enterAccountNameLedgerModal.one: Enter the name of the account you’re signing in to

type.RetriesExceeded: Exceeded maximum attempts for this transaction.
type.LackBalanceForState: Your available balance is too low to perform any actions on your account. Please send NEAR to your account, then import your account again.
type.LackBalanceForTx: Your available balance is too low to cover the transaction cost. Please send NEAR to your account and try again.

ledger.U2FNotSupported: U2F browser support is needed for Ledger. Please use Chrome, Opera or Firefox with a U2F extension. Also make sure you're on an HTTPS connection.
ledger.U2F_4: Failed to sign with Ledger device: U2F DEVICE_INELIGIBLE. Please make sure that your Ledger device is connected and unlocked.

recoveryMethods.lastMethod: Cannot delete your last recovery method. Unless you have Ledger enabled, you need to keep at least one recovery method active to ensure recoverability of your account.
recoveryMethods.setupMethod: An error occured. Please check your recovery method.

networkBanner.title: Test-only Wallet
networkBanner.desc: This wallet (and network) are for testing purposes only. Tokens and other assets have no value. Accounts created do not transfer to Mainnet.

stagingBanner.title: Warning: This is a pre-release version of Wallet. Use at your own risk!
stagingBanner.desc: Warning: This is a pre-release version of the NEAR Wallet. There may be bugs, and these bugs may lead to loss of funds. By continuing to use this version, you agree that you understand and accept these risks, and understand that the NEAR Wallet team will be unable to help you.

landing.title: NEAR is here.
landing.desc: Securely store and stake your NEAR tokens and compatible assets with NEAR Wallet.
landing.banner: NEAR Wallet is in Private Beta
